title: CaCO3 in eggshells - concentration of HCl

content.question: Another sample of eggshell reacts completely with <math alttext="4.0 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of an <math alttext="H C l, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCl</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> solution of unknown concentration. If the reaction produced <math alttext="0.095 atmosphere" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.095</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of gas, the concentration of the <math alttext="H C l aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCl</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> solution was at least

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
